title: Rome IV Diagnostic Criteria for Fecal Incontinence
desc: The Rome IV Criteria for Fecal Incontinence provides criteria for diagnosis of fecal incontinence.

orgreference.text: Rao SS, Bharucha AE, Chiarioni G, et al. Functional Anorectal Disorders. Gastroenterology. 2016; 150: 1430-1442.

other_refer.text: Wald A, Bharucha AE, Cosman BC, Whitehead WE. ACG clinical guideline: management of benign anorectal disorders. Am J Gastroenterol. 2014 Aug;109(8):1141-57.

data.evidence:
To fulfill the Rome IV criteria for fecal incontinence,* patient must have the following for 3 months prior (for research studies, consider onset of symptoms for ≥6 months prior with 24 episodes of FI over 4 weeks):

  1. Recurrent uncontrolled passage of fecal material in an individual with a developmental age of ≥4 years.

*Defined as the recurrent uncontrolled passage of fecal material for ≥3 months.
